name: InterContinental Samui Baan Taling Ngam Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had been to this resort since it was called Le Meridien then Baan Taling Ngam and now Intercontinental and It's getting better each time I visit the place.
reviews.title: Some legends just get better

reviews.text: The location was nice, beautiful and peaceful. The sunset there was wonderful.
reviews.title: Best stay of our life

reviews.text: The food at Amber was very delicious.
reviews.title: Wow beauty at its best!

reviews.text: The price was very reasonable. Great Value!!!
reviews.title: "Service and Sunsets...and amazing food"

reviews.text: Amazing hotel! Dramatic setting, great food, activities, beautiful hotel rooms. This was the best hotel weve ever stayed at! Coolest pools, rope bridge./We wish we would have spent our whole stay at the Intercontinental.
reviews.title: Views and staff amazing but still something missing
A great start to a holiday
reviews.text: We booked the Intercon knowing it was remote and would not be overrun with people to allow us time to really unwind and get settled into our two week holiday. Not to mention we needed to recover from the jet lag following our 12 hour flight that was 3 hours delayed.

We arrived late Saturday and were greeted at the airport by our driver complete with cold towels and drinks for the 40 min ride. Arriving onto the hotel grounds you immediately know this is going to be a great place. Check in was quick and we were shown to our room. For this trip we chose the Serenity package and elected for the one bed panoramic suite in the main building. The package included yoga, 2 hours in the spa, breakfast, lunch on one of the days, transfers, and a personal butler.
reviews.title: A place perfect to get away from it all.

reviews.text: The staff, the room, the food, all was great about this resort. We were unable to get our yoga session due to issues with the teacher however we asked for more spa time in exchange and were given it plus late check out to accommodate the spa timings. The only complaint I could even consider is that we couldn't stay longer! We left recharged and ready to go. The hotel provided the transfer to our next location, about 10 min away.
reviews.title: A great surprise

reviews.text: Just back from a stay at the Intercontinental in Samui, if time out in a secluded part of Samui in a relaxed atmosphere with breath taking views is what you are after them the Intercontinental is perfect! If you want somewhere close to Chaweng and a busy night life, then Intercontinental is not for you!
reviews.title: Quality resort hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is set on a cliff with the most amazing views over the sea and especially at sunset, they are actually breath taking!
reviews.title: Perfect gateway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I, celebrated out 21st Anniversary at the Intercon Samui Baan Taling Ngam from Oct 17-20. Before booking this hotel, our initial concern was the secluded part of Koh Samui that Intercon Samui is located. But after staying there for 3 nights, we were so glad we chose the Intercon at Taling Ngam and not another beach resort at Lamai or Chaweng (more to this later)!
reviews.title: Memorable Holiday

reviews.text: As most have reviewed here, the Intercon Samui is situated on a hilly slope facing the beach. Very very spectacular view of the sea all around! Especially during sunset. Being an IHG member, the check-in was hassle free and though we were way too early for the supposed check-in time of 2pm (our one and only flight from Singapore arrived on Koh Samui at 10am and we were at the hotel by 11am), we were shown our room within 30 minutes. Very impressive!
reviews.title: My Vacation October 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regine, the front desk Manager (?...sorry if I got your designation wrong) took the effort to greet the guests, including ourselves, and really made the guests feel comfortable by chatting with them each day. We love her friendly disposition and her service/guest-comes-first attitude. She is really a star at the hotel!
reviews.title: Stunning hotel in beautiful surrounds

reviews.text: The room is perfect to us, with the bed facing a magnificent view of the ocean that looked right ahead into the horizon. We slept with the shades fully opened each night, so that when we woke up in the morning, we would be greeted with a calming sea of blue! Loved it.
reviews.title: Paradise on earth~~~ Excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Koh Samui is not a big island, with only 1 main road connecting the entire island. And very few traffic lights! Upon arrival at the rustic hut-style airport, we decided at the spur-of-the-moment to rent a car instead of taking the hotel transfer and public transport. Thanks so much to the hotel staff who waited patiently for us while we got the documentation done for the car rental. Sorry we didn't get your name. Getting the car was probably the best move we made that day. As I've mentioned about Intercon Samui being far away from the hustle and bustle of Koh Samui (namely Chaweng), we had the opportunity to drive around to any place on the island we fancied. That would not have been possible without a car. The other option is a scooter rental, but we couldn't ride to save our lives, so a car it was!
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: As soon as you arrive in the lobby, you stay without a word just staring to the amazing view !!! Then you start to really relax, Here comes the enjoyement ...
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.text: The room was really large, well organized with fantastic amenities.
reviews.title: Could be better..

reviews.text: Service has been good, the team is really helpful and nice, you can really feel the wish to serve and help you.
reviews.title: The greatest view ever
Wow! Such attention to detail!
reviews.text: What an amazing day when you start with a nice breakfast watching a quiet, peaceful sea, then you decide to go down to the fantastic beach just next to the quiet and lovely pool. 3pm just time to enjoy a great massage in the lovely Spa, rest a bit on the outside terrasse of the Spa (with just an other amazing view) then go for a nice cocktail in the lobby or the bar watching the "fairy tale" sunset.
honestly, What a great experience !!! Thanks a lot, Intercont team !!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel with superb food!

aka: Baan Taling Ngam Resort And Spa
description: InterContinental Samui Baan Taling Ngam is renowned for its legendary status as Koh Samui’s first ever luxury resort. Nestled on a dramatic cliff of Taling Ngam, with spectacular views over the bay and the neighboring Five Islands. The resort features chic and innovative dining, seven swimming pools, 79 beautifully appointed rooms, suites and villas including the iconic Beachfront Pool Villas. Baan Thai Spa and the famed Air Bar complete the picture
